title: Bug 5340: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
OB: When adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately. Eventually, the exception list comes up, but it ignores the cancellation request.
EB: When adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog should not close immediately. It should either honor the cancellation request or disable the cancel button. To achieve this, when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run, pass 'false' for the 'cancelable' parameter.
SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Go to the breakpoints menu.
3. Click on 'Add exception breakpoint' option.
4. Observe that the progress dialog closes immediately.
5. Verify that eventually, the exception list comes up, but it ignores the cancellation request.
6. Verify that the cancel button is not disabled.
7. Expected behavior: The progress dialog should not close immediately, it should either honor the cancellation request or disable the cancel button.
